ticket_subject: Smoking in Smoke-Free Area at 2411 East 3 Street, Brooklyn (unique_key: 67084030)

comment.comment_body: Thank you for reporting this smoking/vaping violation in your residential building. We've assigned this complaint to our Department of Health and Mental Hygiene supervisor for investigation and enforcement action. Our team will contact the building management and conduct an inspection to ensure compliance with the smoke-free policy. You can expect follow-up within 5-10 business days, and we'll work to resolve this health and safety concern.

dispatcher_result.justification: Assigned MEDIUM priority because this is a health code violation concerning secondhand smoke exposure in a residential building, which poses health risks but is not an immediate life-threatening emergency. Assigned DOHMH supervisor James Thompson as the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene is responsible for smoking and vaping violations enforcement. No crew assignment needed as this requires regulatory inspection and enforcement rather than field maintenance work.

ticket_subject: Damaged Tree on East 48 Street in Brooklyn (unique_key: 67082300)

comment.comment_body: Thank you for reporting this safety concern. We take hanging branches that pose a risk to pedestrians and vehicles very seriously. We've immediately assigned our Parks Department supervisor and our nearest tree service crew to assess and address this hazard. Please avoid walking under or parking near the branch if possible, and expect our crew to arrive within 2-4 hours to evaluate and remove the damaged branch.

dispatcher_result.justification: Assigned HIGH priority due to immediate public safety hazard posed by the cracked, hanging tree branch with explicit risk of falling and causing injury or property damage. Phone origin indicates the reporter's urgent concern. Assigned Robert Williams (DPR Parks Supervisor) for oversight. Assigned Foxtrot Tree Service Team—the closest active tree crew at 0.116 degrees distance—for emergency branch removal and hazard mitigation.

ticket_subject: Water Leak from Hydrant on Atlantic Avenue (unique_key: 67081191)

comment.comment_body: Thank you for reporting the leaking fire hydrant on Atlantic Avenue. This is a serious issue affecting water conservation and public safety, and we've assigned our Department of Environmental Protection supervisor and our drain maintenance crew for immediate investigation and repair. Given the extended nature of the leak and the slip hazard involved, you can expect our crew to respond within 4-8 hours to assess and repair the hydrant. We appreciate your vigilance in protecting our community.

dispatcher_result.justification: Assigned HIGH priority due to multiple factors: active water infrastructure leak (extended duration), documented slip hazard on public sidewalk, significant water waste affecting community resources, and phone origin indicating reporter urgency. Assigned DEP supervisor (David Martinez) as fire hydrant/water infrastructure issues fall under DEP jurisdiction. Assigned closest active drain crew (Charlie Drain Maintenance Team, 0.137 degrees away) for emergency field response. Applied Safety Hazard and Water Main Break labels to ensure proper routing and emergency flagging.

comment.comment_body: Thank you for reporting this rodent activity at your residence. We've assigned the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene supervisor to investigate and coordinate rodent control services for your property at 98-27 74th Avenue. An inspector will contact you to schedule a site visit and discuss treatment options. You can expect to hear from our department within 2-3 business days to arrange the inspection.

dispatcher_result.justification: Assigned MEDIUM priority due to multiple confirmed rodent sightings at residential property with stated health concerns, warranting prompt investigation. Phone origin indicates resident urgency. Assigned DOHMH supervisor (James Thompson) as rodent control falls exclusively under Health Department jurisdiction. No field crews assigned - DOHMH will handle investigation and coordinate pest control treatment through established agency protocols. Residential location in Queens does not escalate to HIGH priority without confirmed infestation posing immediate public health threat.

ticket_subject: Dirty Condition on Sidewalk at 2159 Broadway (unique_key: 67079590)

comment.comment_body: Thank you for reporting the dirty conditions on the sidewalk at 2159 Broadway. We've assigned our Department of Sanitation supervisor and a nearby sanitation crew to address this issue. Our team will clean up the accumulated trash and restore the area to proper condition. You can expect the cleanup to be completed within 3-5 business days. We appreciate you helping us maintain our neighborhoods.

dispatcher_result.justification: Assigned MEDIUM priority as this is an accumulated trash/dirty conditions issue that impacts pedestrian experience and public health, but does not present immediate danger. Assigned DSNY supervisor (Jennifer Davis) as sanitation/cleanliness falls under Department of Sanitation jurisdiction. Assigned the closest active sanitation crew (Kilo Sanitation Team, 0.016 degrees away) for efficient field response. Text origin noted but does not escalate priority given issue type. Limited matching labels available in system - applied Sidewalk Repair as closest categorization.
